Chico State is a small university located in Chico, Ca. The people are friend, the professors are professional and the students are stuck between serious college kids and lay back pot smokers. It is a great university for people looking for a career in the education field.
pageTitle: California State University-Chico Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {555143=-Have an open mind! When I first applied to Chico I was nervous that I had picked a school focused only on partying. My mind changed at summer orientation when I saw all of the clubs and opportunities Chico actually gave you. -If you have a meal plan try and organize how many meals a week you should be having. Because both semesters I had so many meals left over and the last week I tried to eat around 5 times a day! -Be prepared for both extreme heat from August to early October, and extreme cold in the winter. And when I say extreme I mean extreme for someone from the Bay Area. (100degrees and 30degrees), 217698=Okay, I'm going to divide the food and dining into two categories-the dining hall on campus and dining out in town. The Sutter Dining Hall was only recently opened in 2011, so it's extremely new and modern. However, the food options aren't necessarily the greatest. But I guarantee if you ask anyone at any school, they'll all tell you that they're dining hall stinks. Now as for downtown dining, it's awesome. There's a great pizza place called Celestino's (it's been a huge staple while I've lived in Chico), and also a burger/bar joint called The Bear (you have to try the jiffy burger...yes, it's a burger with peanut butter on it!), 584889=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot As a business student at Chico State, it is very competetive and i feel that the teachers are there not only to teach you the information required, but also give you real hands on experience with the subject matter. Login to rate or flag the reviews Michael from Chico, CA 12/16/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 9 out of 10 people found this review useful. 3 of 133 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Outgoing people who like both cold and hot weather. Tips for prospective students Get involved in events and if you are scared to do it by yourself, bring a friend. Explore the town on your bike to see all the works of art downtown.
